details.title: Congress in Odisha concedes defeat before counting of votes
details.content:
A day before the counting of votes, Odisha Congress president Niranjan Patnaik Wednesday conceded that the party will not be able to form a government on its own in the state and may lose opposition status also.

The Congress had in 2014 bagged only 16 out of the total 147 seats in Odisha Assembly and had failed to open its account in the Lok Sabha polls.

(CLICK HERE TO READ MORE)

details.title: Counting of votes to be held in 63 centres in Odisha
details.content:
Counting of votes for the 21 Lok Sabha seats and 146 Assembly segments in Odisha will be held at 63 different centres across the state amidst tight security. The counting of votes will start from 8 am on Thursday and will be conducted in around 2,500 tables.

Each counting hall will have at least seven tables each for Assembly and Lok Sabha seats and three officials including a supervisor, a counting assistant and a micro observer will be engaged for each table to ensure free and fair counting of votes.

details.title: With counting to start in minutes, officials getting frisked at entrance of counting centre in BJB College
Aska Congress candidate shot dead hours before counting
details.content: The Congress candidate for Aska Assembly constituency, Manoj Jena, was critically injured in an attack in Berhampur on Wednesday evening. He was returning to Bhubaneswar from Berhampur along with his friend Santosh Jena in a car when near Lanjipalli bypass, two motorcycle-borne youths opened fire at him.

details.title: Counting underway in Odisha
2019 elections will put Odisha in the map of national politics
details.content: In a few hours from now, there would be a clear picture on who is going to form the Government at the Centre and in Odisha. The actual results of General Elections 2019 may or may not turn out according to exit polls projections. But in any case, 2019 elections will be a defining moment for the State.

details.title: Counting delayed in Bhubaneswar
details.content: Counting of votes gets delayed in Bhubaneswar by at least 15 minutes.

details.title: Scenarios that may unfold in Centre and Odisha
details.content:
• BJP makes huge dent in Lok Sabha seats.  BJD retains the Assembly comfortably.
  • BJD sweeps Lok Sabha seats, BJD storms back to Assembly.
  • BJP bags more LS seats than BJD BJP makes tremendous gains in Assembly (40-50 seats) with BJD managing around (75-85 seats) and Congress (20-25 seats).
  • BJP bags more seats in Lok Sabha Hung Assembly in State with BJD and BJP both within touching range.

details.title: Exit poll predictions likely to come true?
details.content: Going by the early trends, it seems the exit poll prediction are liekly to be correct for Odisha. While the BJD is leading in the Assembly constituencies, the Lok Sabha seats look saffron.

details.title: Lok Sabha trends:
details.content: BJP is leading in Nawarangpur and Dhenkanal. BJP candidate Rudra Narayan Pani leads by 63 votes in Dhenkanal, whereas Balabhadra Majhi leads by over 500 votes.

details.title: Lok Sabha trends:
details.content: BJP candidate Aparajita Sarangi leading in Bhubaneswar and Pramila Bisoi of BJD is leading in Aska.

details.title: Niranjan Patnaik, Jay Panda trailing
details.content:
Odisha Congress president Niranjan Patnaik is trailing in both the Assembly seats - Bhandaripokhari and Ghasipura -- he contested from. Minister Prafulla Samal is leading in Bhandaripokhari, while minister Badri Narayan Patra is leading in Ghasipura.

BJP's Jay Panda trailing by 45027 votes from Odisha's Kendrapara Lok Sabha constituency.

details.title: Rahul Gandhi concedes defeat in Amethi
details.content: Congress President Rahul Gandhi: I had said that during the campaign 'janta maalik hai' and today people have clearly given their decision. I congratulate the PM and BJP.  "I respect the decision and congratulate Smriti Irani ji,"said Gandhi.

Thank you PM @narendramodi ji for your wishes on @bjd_odisha’s spectacular performance in #OdishaElections2019. Congratulate #NDA and @BJP4India for the huge victory in #LokSabhaElections2019. Look forward to working together for the people of #Odisha.

details.title: Result update:
details.content:
• BJD's Lok Sabha candidate for Dhenkanal Mahesh Sahu leads by 24,000 votes against BJP candidate Rudra narayan Pany.
  • BJP candidate Bhabani Shankar Bhoi leads by 16,073 votes in Talsara Assembly segment. 
  • BJD candidate Ranendra Pratap Swain leading in Athagarh by over 30,000 votes.
  • BJP candidate Prakash Soren leading in Baripada Assembly segment by over 13,000 votes.

details.title: Patra still leading in Puri
details.content: Puri Lok Sabha constituency witnesses a tough fight. BJP candidate Sambit Patra is leading by only 1154 votes against BJD's Pinaki Mishra as per the latest trends.

details.title: Ex-President Pranab Mukherjee sends wishes to Naveen Patnaik
details.content:
Congratulations CM Shri @Naveen_Odisha on your historic victory. As you enter your 5th consecutive term, my goodwishes are there with you and the people of Odisha. May you lead the state on path of progress and development.#CitizenMukherjee

— Pranab Mukherjee (@CitiznMukherjee) May 23, 2019

details.title: Counting to go on through out the night
details.content: Average counting rounds for each constituency is around 35. 30 to 40% rounds still remaining. Counting and data updation will continue through out the night: CEO Surendra Kumar

details.title: BJD marks one more win
details.content: BJD's Sudam Marandi wins Bangriposi Assembly segment.

details.title: Want to thank women for voting in large numbers: Naveen Patnaik
details.content: Odisha CM & BJD chief Naveen Patnaik: I'd like to express deep gratitude to people of our state who showered their blessings on BJD.I'd also like to thank leaders&workers of the party who worked hard.I want to thank particularly women of Odisha who came out in large no. to vote for us

details.title: BJD's Pramila Mallick wins
details.content: Senior leader and former minister Pramila Mallick, a strong woman face of BJD, wins by over 21,000 votes from Binjharpur assembly seat.

details.title: Chandrababu Naidu, former CM of Andhra congratulates Naveen Patnaik for BJD's thumping victory
details.content:
I respect people's mandate and hope that the new govt will live up to their expectations and serve them with honesty.

My heartfelt congratulations to @ysjagan garu.

I also congratulate Sri @narendramodi and @BJP4India.

Lauding Sri @Naveen_Odisha for his thumping win in Odisha.

— N Chandrababu Naidu (@ncbn) May 23, 2019
